revised_title: The Influence of Wavelength on Luminous Efficiency of Light Rays Entering the Eye Pupil at Different Points
tldr: This study investigates how the efficiency of monochromatic light rays entering the eye at different points affects brightness perception. The research found that the ratio of luminous efficiencies of rays entering centrally and peripherally varies systematically across the spectrum. Additionally, a new color effect was discovered, providing evidence of differences in properties of the three types of receptor cells postulated in the trichromatic theory.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Visual Perception
